author: cskwrd
body:
Hey everyone,

Sorry for asking a question that isn't strictly related to the development of powershell itself, but I can't find an answer to this it.

How are we supposed to call cmdlets that are located in other modules or otherwise defined elsewhere?

To me it seems like I must create a new runspace and pass a string representing what I want to execute to it.

comments.author: BrucePay
comments.body: Hi @cskwrd I'm not sure I understand exactly what you're asking. The basic answer is to install the module if it isn't already installed, load the module (or let autoloading do it for you) then call the cmdlet. (But I'm guessing that's not the answer you're looking for.)

comments.author: cskwrd
BrucePay
cskwrd
comments.body: @BrucePay Thanks for the info! This is what I needed.

title: Consuming external modules/cmdlets from binary modules
